entries.content: Session started with Moti - refreshed memory on thinking feature implementation completed in previous session (2025-11-07). Successfully retrieved delta memories showing complete implementation: parameter threading, environment variable injection, chunk routing, and UI streaming display all working. Ready to continue with provider-specific thinking display designs.

Discovered provider-specific design pattern in Sementix:
1. ProviderDetector checks active provider (isClaudeProvider(), isCodexProvider(), isGeminiProvider())
2. Provider-specific CSS classes applied (.claude-icon, .openai-icon, .gemini-icon)
3. Provider-specific cooking indicators with different animations
4. ProviderIconComponent creates consistent icons across UI
5. Each provider has unique colors: Claude orange (#d97757), OpenAI white, Gemini multi-color

For thinking display, need to:
- Add provider detection to ReasoningChunkHandler
- Create provider-specific thinking indicator classes
- Apply provider-specific colors/animations
- Pass providerId through streaming pipeline to thinking handler

Successfully implemented provider-specific thinking displays: COMPLETED: 1. Updated ReasoningChunkHandler.js - Added domReferences dependency, getProviderId() method, provider name mapping, and createThinkingIndicatorHTML() to generate provider-specific HTML with icon and label 2. Updated ComponentFactory.js - Wired domReferences to both ReasoningChunkHandler and ReasoningMessageBuilder 3. Created provider-specific CSS in message-thinking.css - Added .thinking-claude, .thinking-openai, .thinking-gemini, .thinking-qwen classes with unique colors 4. Updated ReasoningMessageBuilder.js - Made it provider-aware for non-streaming reasoning messages STRUCTURE: - Streaming: ReasoningChunkHandler creates provider-specific HTML on first chunk - Non-streaming: ReasoningMessageBuilder creates provider-specific HTML - Both use ChatStore lookup via domReferences.getChatStore().get(chatId).providerId - Provider-specific CSS classes: .thinking-container.thinking-{provider} - Provider icons: Ready to test!

Provider-specific thinking display implementation COMPLETE! 

Build successful - ready for testing.

TESTING INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Reload VS Code extension
2. Start new chat with Claude provider
3. Enable thinking toggle
4. Send message to trigger thinking
5. Verify:
   - Thinking indicator shows Claude icon
   - Text says "Claude is thinking..."
   - Border/glow uses Claude orange color (#d97757)
   - Thinking text streams smoothly
   
Each provider (Claude, OpenAI, Gemini, Qwen) now has its own themed thinking display!

Quantum Fade Animation for Thinking Display - COMPLETE! ‚ú®

1. src/ui/templates/css/text-effects/quantum-fade/quantum-fade-text.css

EFFECT: Thinking text now has subtle quantum superposition effect with provider-colored ghost layers that split left/right while text breathes and pulses. Beautiful! üåü

Fixed quantum fade animation - switched from pseudo-element approach to glow-based approach!

ISSUE: Original implementation used ::before and ::after pseudo-elements with content:'' which didn't work with dynamic streaming text.

SOLUTION: Changed to provider-specific animated glow effects using text-shadow:
- Breathing animation with subtle scale (1.0 ‚Üí 1.015)
- Horizontal oscillation (-0.3px ‚Üê ‚Üí 0.5px)
- Multi-layer text-shadow creating quantum glow effect
- Each provider gets unique colored glow animations

ANIMATIONS:
- quantumFadeClaude: Orange/peachy glow
- quantumFadeOpenAI: White/blue-white glow
- quantumFadeGemini: Blue/purple glow
- quantumFadeQwen: Purple/magenta glow
- quantumFadeDefault: Blue/purple for unknown providers

EFFECT: Text now pulses with provider-colored glow, scales slightly, and oscillates horizontally creating ethereal quantum effect!

Fixed quantum glow placement - moved to header text only!

User wanted quantum effect ONLY on "Claude is thinking..." header, not the thinking content.

CHANGES:
1. Moved quantum-text class from .thinking-text div to .thinking-text-label span
2. Updated both ReasoningChunkHandler and ReasoningMessageBuilder
3. Updated CSS selector from .thinking-text.quantum-text to .thinking-text-label.quantum-text
4. Added display: inline-block to ensure transform animations work on span

NOW: Only the header text "Claude is thinking..." has the quantum glow effect
CONTENT: Regular thinking text streams without animation (clean and readable)
